name: Community Trust Bancorp, Inc.
description: Community Trust Bancorp, Inc. is a financial services holding company based in the United States, primarily engaged in providing financial products and services through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Community Trust Bank, Inc. Founded in 1903, the company has deep roots in the communities it serves, focusing on personal and business banking solutions. Community Trust Bancorp offers a wide range of services, including checking and savings accounts, loans, mortgages, investment services, and wealth management. With an emphasis on community involvement and customer service, the bank strives to meet the financial needs of individuals and businesses in its operating regions, which encompass parts of Kentucky, West Virginia, and Tennessee. The company's mission is to enhance the quality of life in the communities it serves by building lasting relationships with its customers and providing tailored financial solutions. Over the years, Community Trust Bancorp has cultivated a reputation for stability and reliability, making it a trusted partner for financial success.
ceo: Mark A. R. L. A. Sturgill

key_executives.name: Mark A. R. L. A. Sturgill

seo.meta_title: Community Trust Bancorp, Inc. | Banking and Financial Services
seo.meta_description: Explore Community Trust Bancorp, Inc., a leader in banking and financial services dedicated to enhancing community well-being through personalized financial solutions.

faq.question: What services does Community Trust Bancorp offer?
faq.answer: Community Trust Bancorp offers personal banking, business banking, investment services, and wealth management.

faq.question: Where is Community Trust Bancorp headquartered?
faq.answer: Community Trust Bancorp is headquartered in Pikeville, Kentucky, USA.

faq.question: When was Community Trust Bancorp founded?
faq.answer: Community Trust Bancorp was founded in 1903.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Community Trust Bancorp?
faq.answer: Mark A. R. L. A. Sturgill is the CEO of Community Trust Bancorp, Inc.
